frameDefinitions: A stretch of linguistic discourse or a Text that a Communicator produces has a Topic that it is about.
A Topical_entity has properties which are affected by the existence and association of an Entity.

A Researcher (an individual a group or institution) attempts to answer a Question by means of consulting literature,  observation, or conducting experiments in a particular Field pertinent to the Question.
A group of Arguers (also expressible as Arguer1 and Arguer2) express incompatible opinions or beliefs about an Issue.
A Speaker makes a commitment to an Addressee to carry out some future action.

This is an abstract frame for durative activities, in which the Agent enters an ongoing state of the Activity, remains in this state for some Duration of Time, and leaves this state either by finishing or by stopping.
frameExamples: By the 1920s a characteristic book <t>had</t> black and white photographic illustrations only .
Simmons and Nadel did <t>research</t> pertaining to Ardea purpurea and Egretta garzetta in 1998
We <t>bickered</t> about semantics for an hour.
You <t>promised</t> me you'd come to my graduation.
listRoleDefinitions: The <fen>Topic</fen> is what a <fen>Text</fen> is about.
A set of propositions that is coherent in being about a <fen>Topic</fen>
The <fen>Communicator</fen> is the person who has produced a <fen>Text</fen> on a <fen>Topic</fen>.
The time at which the <fen>Communicator</fen> produces <fen>Text</fen> on a <fen>Topic</fen>.
Some entity, abstract or concrete, which is stated to exist and be associated with the <fen>Topical_entity</fen>.
The entity under discussion, whose states and properties are impacted by its association with the <fen>Entity</fen>.
The time at which the <fen>Entity</fen> exists and is associated with the <fen>Topical_entity</fen>
The place where the <fen>Entity</fen> is associated with the <fen>Topical_entity</fen>.
The people engaged in a research endeavor.
An area of inquiry.
A significant unanswered open proposition which the <fen>Researcher</fen> is attempting to resolve.
A phenomenon or idea involved in a <fen>Question</fen>.
The time when  the research is carried out.
The physical place where the research is carried out.
A group of people in an argument.
A person who is arguing with Arguer2.
The person who is being argued with by <fen>Arguer1</fen>.
The the thing the the <fen>Arguers</fen> are arguing over or about.
The time when the argument takes place.
The location at which the <fen>Arguers</fen> quarrel

The Speaker is the person who commits him/herself to do something.  Speaker is usually the External Argument of predicative uses of the target or the Genitive modifier of a noun: <fex name='Speaker'>Jo</fex> made a <t>promise</t> to me. <fex name='Speaker'>Jo</fex> <t>promised</t> me she would cook dinner. <fex name='Speaker'>Jo's</fex> <t>promise</t> to cook dinner came to nothing.

The Speaker's commitment can be made to an Addressee.  With those words which allow this frame element to be expressed, Addressee usually occurs as a PP Complement headed by <ment>to</ment> or the (Indirect) Object of verbs: Kim made a <t>promise</t> <fex name='Addressee'>to me</fex>. Kim <t>promised</t> <fex name='Addressee'>me</fex> that everything would be okay.

An expression of the commitment made by the Speaker expresses the frame element Message.  Message is expressed as a finite or non-finite clausal Complement or an NP Object: I <t>swore</t> <fex name='Message'>that I would never make the same mistake again</fex>. The owner finally <t>consented</t> <fex name='Message'>to sell the business</fex>. They <t>threatened</t> <fex name='Message'>revenge</fex>.
Topic expressions are not very frequent in this frame. They can occur with noun targets. Jo made endless <t>promises</t> <fex name='Topic'>about working harder at school</fex>.

As with other frames in the Communication domain, the <t>Medium</t> of communication may be expressed. Medium is the physical entity or channel used to transmit the Message. Bob <t>threatened</t> the workers <fex name='Medium'>in Spanish</fex>.
The time period during which the <fen>Speaker</fen> makes the commitment.
The location in which the <fen>Speaker</fen> makes the commitment.
This role identifies the <fen>Activity</fen> in which the  <fen>Agent</fen>  is engaged.
The <fen>Agent</fen> is engaged in the <fen>Activity</fen>.
This role identifies the <fen>Time</fen> when the <fen>Activity</fen> occurs.
This role identifies the <fen>Place</fen> where the <fen>Activity</fen> occurs.
listRoleExamples: In his book, <fex>Smithers</fex> discusses cotton production.
Before he became an astronaut, <fex>Grunsfeld</fex> did research in physics.
When we have researched <fex>why Brazilian mothers have stopped breastfeeding</fex>, principal reasons given are 'poor milk' and 'insufficient milk' .
Would you take part in research <fex>on the best place to have a baby</fex>?

<fex>During summer of 1999</fex>, I did research using a technique called 'Path Integral Monte
Carlo', to simulate quantum particles.
Johnson and Randall's research <fex>in Africa</fex> has proven extremely valuable.

The chancellor <fex>yesterday</fex> promised to increase defence spending in real terms next
year.
The july framework has reaffirmed what was promised <fex>at Doha</fex>.
